questions.question_text:
A Service Coordinator (SC) for Ursa Major Solar (UMS) does a final review of work orders owned by a technician for a specific region before the records are submitted for an invoice. Before closing out the work order, the SC needs to modify data or remove attachments that were added by mistake. The SC also needs access to any other related records owned by the technician.

What solution would provide the required access, given a private data model?

choices.D: Change work order access on the SC’s profile to ‘Modify All’.
choices.C: Give the SC a permission set with the Modify All Data system permission.
choices.B: Create a workflow rule that updates records owned by technicians in that region with the SC.
choices.A: Put the SC in the role hierarchy above the technicians whose work orders they review.

discussion.content:
Correct answer is A.

A. Put the SC in the role hierarchy above the technicians whose work orders they review: In a private sharing model, access to records is determined by the role hierarchy. By placing the SC in a role that is higher in the hierarchy than the technicians, the SC will inherit access to the work orders and related records owned by those technicians. This approach respects the existing security model and provides the necessary access without requiring extensive changes to permissions or profiles.

choices.C: Create a text-only custom Lightning Web Component > Clone the case page layout > Drag the custom Lightning Web Component into the page, and assign the layout to platinum cases.
choices.A: Clone the Case Lightning page > Add a rich text component to the new page, and assign this page to platinum accounts.
choices.B: Create a text-only custom Lightning Web Component > Drag the custom Lightning Web Component into the Case page layout > Set its visibility to show when the account support level is platinum.

discussion.content:
D.
The app builder needs to provide sharing rules on the Request Inventory object because it is the junction object in a many-to-many relationship between the Inventory and Order objects. Sharing rules determine the level of visibility users have to the Request Inventory records, such as read or edit access.

Without sharing rules on the Request Inventory object, users may not be able to view or interact with the Request Inventory records, which would hinder their ability to track orders against inventory and fulfill order requests. By setting appropriate sharing rules, the app builder can ensure that users have the necessary access to the Request Inventory records to carry out their responsibilities and achieve the desired business outcome.
